author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Congress on Friday described the meeting Union Minister M. Venkaiah Naidu had with its president Sonia Gandhi to gather support for the Goods and Services Tax (GST) Bill as a tactic to “distract” the attention from the alleged mishandling of the Pathankot terror attack.

On Thursday, Mr. Naidu met Ms. Gandhi to discuss passage of the Bill in the budget session of Parliament. Senior Congress leader Shaktisinh Gohil said Mr. Naidu had nothing new to say about the Bill. “He did not talk about the Congress’s objections. He just said the government was considering our suggestions and would take a decision soon.”

Rejecting the government’s charge that the Congress was blocking the Bill, Mr. Gohil said it was the BJP government that had been following the RSS-driven plot of “sabotaging” it. “The real truth is that the GST stands red-flagged for the past nine years by the RSS and its affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch,” Mr. Gohil said.
title: Govt. adopting diversionary tactics: Cong.
